N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 240.2 - Procedures

State Regulations
(a) The board of
education, board of trustees, sole trustee or other governing body of each
school district shall adopt a simplified legal district name consisting
substantially of: (1)
geographic designation
(such as the name of a town, village or hamlet in which the district is
located)
(2)
type of district
(central, union free, common, or central high, as appropriate)
(3)
designation--the words "school
district". (b) Each
school district shall thereupon submit to the commissioner for approval a
certified copy of the resolution by the board of education, board of trustees, sole trustee or other governing body of the school district adopting a name in
accordance with the provisions of this Part. Proposed names which are identical
with, or so similar to, a name previously approved for use by another school
district as to cause confusion will not be approved. (c) The commissioner will issue a certificate
setting forth the approved simplified legal district name, the former legal
name, the post office address and street address of the school district office
or of the main school building, the names of the towns and counties in which
the school district is located, and, where a part of the school district is
located in a city, the name of such city, and the effective date of the
simplified legal district name, which will be not less than 30 days after the
date of such certificate. Notes
